utilities
Class met_processor

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--utilities.met_processor
public class met_processor
extends java.lang.Object

Overview

This class provides a collection of subroutines helpful in manipulating meteorological data. -999 is typically used to signify that meteorological data is not existant or faulty. -999 is used for bad data rather than 0 because 0 sometimes represents a valid data point. These routines assume that data that is less than -990 is a from bad reading. Bad readings will not be incorporated into descriptive statistic calculations.

Version:
1.0 (October 2001)
Author:
Tony Held

          Convert an angle in the geometric convention where angles are measured counter clockwise from the x axis to the meteorological convention where north is zero and a positive angle is measured clock wise.

          This routine sums up all the values in an array excluding the bad (less than -990) values, if there are no good values then the sum will return -999.9.

wind_vector_average

public static double[] wind_vector_average(double[] wind_speed,
                                           double[] wind_angle)
Determine the average of the wind speeds, resultant wind vector magnatitude, and resultant wind vector direction given two double arrays. The first array is the wind speed, the second is the wind_angle in standard meteorological convention The function returns a double[3] in the following format: (average of wind speeds, wind speed resultant magnitude , wind speed resultant angle) All values less than -990 are not considered in the statistical calculations. Calculation errors will result in returned value of -999.9.

cast_matrix

public static double[][] cast_matrix(long[][] long_matrix)
